hints.content:
An $\blueE{\text{even}}$ number is a number that can be split into $2$ equal groups.

We find $\blueE{\text{even}}$ numbers by making sure every object in the group has a pair.

![2 rows of cookies. Row 1 has 3 cookies. Row 2 has 3 cookies. A vertical dotted line divides the cookies into 3 columns so there are 3 pairs.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/9d50cd961bb1ee962eb60cc708a5e737e9d4486c)

Examples of $\blueE{\text{even}}$ numbers are $\blueE2, \blueE4,\blueE6, \blueE8, \blueE{10},  . .  .$

An $\maroonD{\text{odd}}$ number **cannot** be split into $2$ equal groups. 

We find $\maroonD{\text{odd}}$ numbers by trying to pair objects and finding there is **not** always a pair.

![2 columns of cookies. Column 1 has 3 cookies. Column 2 has 2 cookies. A horizontal dotted line divides the cookies into 3 rows so there are 2 pairs with 1 extra cookie.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/10c3af09ebfcd0c6d05b4edd219f33894cc4d8b9)

Examples of $\maroonD{\text{odd}}$ numbers are $\maroonD1, \maroonD3, \maroonD5, \maroonD7, \maroonD9, . . . $

In this image, there are $\maroonD{17}$ rabbits.

![3 rows of rabbits. Row 1 has 5 rabbits. Row 2 has 6 rabbits. Row 3 has 6 rabbits. Horizontal dotted lines divide the rabbits into 3 rows and vertical dotted lines divide the rabbits into 3 columns. There are 8 pairs with 1 extra rabbit.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c6d4112fd4133f4076c6a8964e8e60055002fecd)

Each rabbit does **not** have a pair, so there are an odd number of rabbits.

In this image, there are $\maroonD{5}$ rabbits.

![1 row of 5 rabbits. Vertical dotted lines divide the rabbits into 3 columns. There are 2 pairs with 1 extra rabbit.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b101063296381e476911c3afbe755303beb8201b)

Each rabbit does **not** have a pair, so there are an odd number of rabbits.

In this image, there are $\blueE{16}$ rabbits.

![4 rows of rabbits. Each row has 4 rabbits. A horizontal dotted line divides the rabbits into 2 rows and vertical dotted lines divide the rabbits into 4 columns. There are 8 pairs of rabbits.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/a5c14c4e9fd9ad9833e8f8ab99e7b3a4c2b1bb5f)

Each rabbit has a pair, so there are an even number of rabbits.

This image shows an even number of rabbits:

![4 rows of rabbits. Each row has 4 rabbits.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/7a8ee66ce4eacd3cc544a2b0fa477d8ca91ad376)

question.content:
**Which image shows an even number of rabbits?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![3 rows of rabbits. Row 1 has 6 rabbits. Row 2 has 6 rabbits. Row 3 has 5 rabbits.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/7fe481b9336eda00fdde6ff1a8a3d38f114c9c45)
![4 rows of rabbits. Each row has 4 rabbits.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/7a8ee66ce4eacd3cc544a2b0fa477d8ca91ad376)
